intro: Andryala varia var. cheiranthifolia, commonly known as the variable andryala, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
